docs.snippet: CANDIDLY this book is propaganda. In it Colonel De Ronde. Paraguayan Consul in New York for the past twenty-five years, undertakes to tell what the Chaco war is about from the Paraguayan point of view. During the 1933 campaign he served with the...
docs.lead_paragraph: CANDIDLY this book is propaganda. In it Colonel De Ronde. Paraguayan Consul in New York for the past twenty-five years, undertakes to tell what the Chaco war is about from the Paraguayan point of view. During the 1933 campaign he served with the Paraguayan Army in the field against Bolivia.

headline.main: Paraguay and the Chaco; PARAGUAY: A Gallant Little Nation. By Philip De Ronde. Foreword by Smedley D. Butler. Illustrated with maps and photographs. 123 pp. New York: G.P. Putnam's Sons. $1.75.

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Dec. 29. -- South America made definite progress toward economic recovery during 1934. All ten republics profited from higher prices paid in world markets for the agricultural and mineral products which form the backbone of their...
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, Dec. 29. -- South America made definite progress toward economic recovery during 1934. All ten republics profited from higher prices paid in world markets for the agricultural and mineral products which form the backbone of their economic set-ups.

headline.main: SOUTH AMERICA HAD A PROSPEROUS YEAR; Economic Progress, However, Was Greater Than Political Improvement.

docs.snippet: ONE of the pleasures of traveling in South America. Mrs. Desmond tells her readers, is that when you return and want to talk about your adventures your friends are likely to listen, since they have not been there themselves.
docs.lead_paragraph: ONE of the pleasures of traveling in South America. Mrs. Desmond tells her readers, is that when you return and want to talk about your adventures your friends are likely to listen, since they have not been there themselves.
docs.abstract: Desmond, Alice Curtis; South American Adventures

headline.main: South American Ports; SOUTH AMERICAN ADVENTURES. By Alice Curtis Desmond. 284 pp. New York: The Macmillan Company. $2.50.
FOREIGN EXCHANGE RATES; WEEK ENDED JAN. 5, 1935.
ARGENTINA BEATS CHILE.; Takes First Game of Title Soccer Series at Lima, 4 to 1.
